job_title: Senior Book Designer in Oakland, CA
pros: Great collaborative workplace, love my department and my managers.
cons: Still a low paying publishing job given my experience and value.

review_title: Wonderful content and staff, bureaucracy from hell
pros: Prestigious academic publisher that provides a great environment for learning the publishing process. Great colleagues and important content is produced.
cons: Poor marks for retention. Senior management pays a lot of lip service to "challenging the status quo" and recognizing employee value, but doesn't take much action to improve the station of junior staff members. Massive amounts of bureaucracy prevent most decisions from being acted upon.

review_title: Working with a passionate team to promote publishing that makes a difference
pros: Marketing and publicizing books and journals that can advance knowledge in its given discipline/field of study, and with an overall team that is passionate about excellence in publishing (and working under the rigorous realities of all of UC Press's books having to go through the peer review process), makes working here deeply meaningful and fulfilling. The team across the board is respectful, collaborative, and constructive, and the upper management is always open and available to one's queries and needs.
cons: Working for a California state government nonprofit organization, within the immensity of the University of California system, means that certain processes can take longer than at other orgs/companies.

pros: A great place to work if you want to connect with very smart people, and to work on high-quality books. Your coworkers here are the main joy; most people who work here are incredibly smart, interesting, and hard working.
cons: Current changes in the scholarly publishing industry, and in the organization itself, make things a bit uncertain. Constantly changing workflows, and in organizational structure, can be frustrating.

pros: Health Benefit, flexible hours, family oriented environment
cons: Poor management, Low Salary for non manager,
